trans-unit.source: Set up a new device with Azure AD during Setup| Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Set up a new device with Azure AD during Setup| Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A topic that explains how users can set up Azure AD Join during their first run experience.
trans-unit.target: A topic that explains how users can set up Azure AD Join during their first run experience.

trans-unit.source: Set up a new device with Azure AD during Setup
trans-unit.target: Set up a new device with Azure AD during Setup

trans-unit.source: In Windows 10, end-users can join their device to Azure AD in the first run experience (FRX).
trans-unit.target: In Windows 10, end-users can join their device to Azure AD in the first run experience (FRX).

trans-unit.source: This will allow organizations to distribute shrink-wrapped devices to their employees or students, or let them choose their own device (CYOD).
trans-unit.target: This will allow organizations to distribute shrink-wrapped devices to their employees or students, or let them choose their own device (CYOD).

trans-unit.source: If you install either the Professional or Enterprise SKU for Windows 10, the experience defaults to the setup for company-owned devices.
trans-unit.target: If you install either the Professional or Enterprise SKU for Windows 10, the experience defaults to the setup for company-owned devices.

trans-unit.source: To join a device to Azure AD
trans-unit.target: To join a device to Azure AD

trans-unit.source: After the **Getting Ready** stage, you are prompted with the Setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: After the **Getting Ready** stage, you are prompted with the Setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: Start by customizing their region and language, accept the EULA and get online.
trans-unit.target: Start by customizing their region and language, accept the EULA and get online.

trans-unit.source: Select the network to connect to the internet.
trans-unit.target: Select the network to connect to the internet.

trans-unit.source: Select if it’s a personal device or a company-owned device:
trans-unit.target: Select if it’s a personal device or a company-owned device:

trans-unit.source: Click **this device belongs to my organization**.
trans-unit.target: Click **this device belongs to my organization**.

trans-unit.source: This starts the Azure AD Join experience.
trans-unit.target: This starts the Azure AD Join experience.

trans-unit.source: Following is a screen that you see in Windows 10 Professional SKU.
trans-unit.target: Following is a screen that you see in Windows 10 Professional SKU.

trans-unit.source: Enter the credentials provided to you by your organization.
trans-unit.target: Enter the credentials provided to you by your organization.

trans-unit.source: Once you have entered your username, a matching tenant is located in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Once you have entered your username, a matching tenant is located in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: If you are in a federated domain, you will be redirected to your on-premises Secure Token Service (STS) server (for example, AD FS).
trans-unit.target: If you are in a federated domain, you will be redirected to your on-premises Secure Token Service (STS) server (for example, AD FS).

trans-unit.source: If you are a user in a non-federated domains, you need to enter your credentials directly on the Azure AD-hosted page.
trans-unit.target: If you are a user in a non-federated domains, you need to enter your credentials directly on the Azure AD-hosted page.

trans-unit.source: You will also see your organization’s logo and support text if Company Branding was configured.
trans-unit.target: You will also see your organization’s logo and support text if Company Branding was configured.

trans-unit.source: You will then be prompted for a multi-factor authentication challenge.
trans-unit.target: You will then be prompted for a multi-factor authentication challenge.

trans-unit.source: This is configurable by IT.
trans-unit.target: This is configurable by IT.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD will then check whether this user/device requires mobile device management (MDM) enrollment.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD will then check whether this user/device requires mobile device management (MDM) enrollment.

trans-unit.source: Windows will then register the device in the organization’s directory in Azure AD and enroll it in MDM.
trans-unit.target: Windows will then register the device in the organization’s directory in Azure AD and enroll it in MDM.

trans-unit.source: When this is done, if you are a managed user, Windows will wrap up the setup process and take the user to the desktop through the auto-logon.
trans-unit.target: When this is done, if you are a managed user, Windows will wrap up the setup process and take the user to the desktop through the auto-logon.

trans-unit.source: If you are a federated user, you land on the Windows logon screen and have to enter your credentials to log on.
trans-unit.target: If you are a federated user, you land on the Windows logon screen and have to enter your credentials to log on.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Joining an on-premises Active Directory domain in the Windows out-of-box experience is not supported.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Joining an on-premises Active Directory domain in the Windows out-of-box experience is not supported.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, if you plan to join a PC to a domain, you should select the link “Set up Windows with a local account instead”.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, if you plan to join a PC to a domain, you should select the link “Set up Windows with a local account instead”.

trans-unit.source: You can then join the domain from PC Settings as you’ve done before.
trans-unit.target: You can then join the domain from PC Settings as you’ve done before.

trans-unit.target: Additional Information
